newsitem.title: FRANCE: French fourth quarter GDP seen flat.
newsitem.headline: French fourth quarter GDP seen flat.

text.p: French gross domestic product (GDP) was flat in the fourth quarter compared to the previous quarter, according to an average of 13 economists' forecasts taken by Reuters on Monday.
Fourth-quarter GDP figures are due at 0745 GMT on Thursday.
In the third quarter, GDP grew 0.9 percent from the previous quarter, according to figures released on January 16.
The government estimated France 1996 growth of 1.3 percent and expects growth of at least 2.3 percent in 1997.

Economists said fourth-quarter GDP would be hit by a drop in consumer spending, which was affected by weak car sales after a government car-buying incentive scheme expired at the end of September. High unemployment also eroded consumer confidence.

Consumer spending on manufactured goods, a narrower definition of consumption than that used in the GDP data and released every month, fell 3.4 percent over the fourth quarter, figures released in January showed.

Economists gave the following forecasts for the change in fourth-quarter GDP from the previous quarter, with a breakdown of their forecasts, where available, added below (percentage change from previous month)
Breakdown of forecasts of GDP components, (percentage contribution to GDP)
